- dictionary: A:0 B:1 AB:2 BA:3 ABA:4 ABB:5 BAA:7 ABBA:8 codeword length: 4 Algorithmics, 2020 Text = A B A B A B B A B A A B B A B B A add: string + char at next position compressed file = 001100100110111011000 LZW decompression - Example 36 step position in file old string code from dictionary string add to dictionary code 0 1 - 0 A - - 1 2 A 01 B AB 2 2 4 B 10 AB BA 3 3 6 AB 010 AB ABA 4 4 9 AB 011 BA ABB 5 5 12 BA 011 BA BAB 6 6 15 BA 101 ABB BAA 7 7 18 ABB 1000 dictionary: A:0 B:1 AB:2 BA:3 ABA:4 ABB:5 BAB:6 BAA:7 codeword length: 3 Algorithmics, 2020 compressed file = 001100100110111011000 string not in dictionary LZW decompression – Special case It is possible to encounter a codeword that is not (yet) in the dictionary − because decompression is ‘out of phase’ with compression − but in that case it is possible to deduce what string it must represent The solution: 37Algorithmics, 2020 if (lookUp fails) s = oldS + oldS.charAt(0); LZW decompression -
